results.title: The Sun pictures
results.creator_credit: Campbell Harper Films, Films of Scotland and David Bruce
results.brief_description: Features photographic portraits of the mid-19th century made by two Scottish photographers, David Octavius Hill and Robert Adamson, of soldiers, dignitaries, personal friends, Clydeside fishermen and the first assembly of the Church of Scotland. All were taken by means of long exposure in strong sunlight. Commentator: Aidan Thomson

results.title: The Sun is our star
results.brief_description: The sun is the Earth’s source of energy and life. Describes the nature of the sun’s rays - ultra violet, infra red, heat and radio waves. Discusses solar spots, solar eclipses, and the polar aurora, their causes and effects such as electrical storms and radio disturbances.

results.title: The Sun goes to work...at home
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
It looks like any other suburban Australian house, but in fact it’s a highly efficient laboratory built in Melbourne for the CSIRO. The purpose is to see how much fuel costs can be reduced by a combination of good insulation, efficient design and an innovative solar heating system.

results.title: The Sun and the earth: the upper atmosphere
results.creator_credit: National Academy of Sciences (U.S.), McGraw-Hill and Lothar Wolff
results.brief_description: The Earth’s atmosphere is known to be a region of diversity with different characteristics at various levels. Describes the location and nature of the phenomena observed in the upper atmosphere that extends from the turbopause outward into space. Explains their importance, and provides a sampling of the techniques used in studying them.

results.title: The Sun and the earth: magnetosphere
results.creator_credit: National Academy of Sciences (U.S.) and Lothar Wolff
results.brief_description: Magnetosphere is a relatively new scientific term, which has been given two meanings: 1. The region of space in which geomagnetic field forces exert a dominant influence upon the motion of charged particles. 2. A similar region surrounding other planets. The purpose of this film is to define its meaning and to describe the efforts of scientists to establish more accurate concepts about it and its significance.

results.title: The Sun
results.creator_credit: Media Four Productions and Charles L. Finance
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Solar System”.
Provides a theory of how the sun was created and indicates its value to earth in terms of energy. Also gives some insight into the nature of the sun’s surface and the relationship between sunspots and weather patterns.

results.title: The Sun
results.creator_credit: Coastal Community Colleges and David P. Stone
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Universe: the infinite frontier: an introductory astronomy telecourse”.
The sun is the most familiar star to us in our galaxy. It provides us with energy, light and heat and sustains life on the planet. Even though the possibility of reaching the sun seems in the realms of science fiction, astronomers know a great deal about the sun and can apply that knowledge to the study of other celestial bodies. This episode looks at the composition of the sun, phenomenon such as sunspots and solar flares and the internal structure of this medium sized yet most important star.

results.title: The Summer we moved to Elm Street (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Guy Glover and Patricia Watson
results.brief_description: In our mobile society some families move a lot, and children have to make new friends just when they are becoming comfortable with the ones they have. This film tries to show what goes on in the mind of a nine-year-old girl who finds her happiness disturbed both by a move to another street and by her father’s increasing drunkenness. Cast includes Darlene Harcourt, Jane Morphew, Maggi Morris and Larry Reynolds. (Award: Washington)

results.title: The Summer game
results.brief_description: Traces the history of cricket from its origin as a two stump game played by yokels on the village green, through its phase as a betting sport after the Restoration, to the modern counterpart played by professionals.
